text: Example 5.3. Suppose our list contains n integers between 0 and 2™ — 1 in- clusive, so as the list gets longer, so can the values. Let’s use b = 2 so that we need d = n of them. If we use RadixSort+CountingSort then the underlying CountingSort has k = maz = 1 and therefore is ©(n + 1) and so the resulting RadixSort will be ©(n(n + 1)) = ©(n?).
